The black stone dragon is the final boss of the second elite dungeon, the Dragonkin Laboratory. She is a dragonkin experiment based on gemstone dragons using a type of corruptive black stone.

She was created by Kerapac, who implanted black stones onto a dragon from Vicendithas' old batch. The dragon also had a sister dragon, which Kerapac placed on Anachronia to guard his laboratory. The dialogue during the fight and the dragonkin research diary (as well as dialogue from the Ambassador) suggest that the black stone implants allowed Xau-Tak to influence her.[1][2] After an accident that saw the destruction of another specimen, Kerapac sealed her away in the laboratory, for fear of her extremely uncontrollable nature.

Strategy[edit | edit source]

Main article: Dragonkin Laboratory/Strategies

The black stone dragon can attack with all three combat styles, but primarily uses magic attacks. After she has taken some damage, she will summon four black hands that use slow but hard-hitting magic attacks while becoming invulnerable herself. Once all four hands are destroyed, she will continue the fight while adding in a few extra special attacks. After taking a certain amount of damage, she will again become invulnerable and fly around the battlefield, leaving slow-moving lines of white fire that can damage the player. Once this is done, she will continue using her default attacks and selective special abilities until she is defeated.

Quests[edit | edit source]

Curse of the Black Stone[edit | edit source]

The following takes place during Curse of the Black Stone.

Curse of the Black Stone quest requires completion of all 3 elite dungeons before or during the quest. As such, the black stone dragon must be faced and defeated at least once; this can be done solo or in a group, as well as on either normal mode or story mode.

Drops[edit | edit source]

Due to one or more updates, this article may be out of date.
Reason: Group draconic energy drop rates were updated in Update:This Week In RuneScape: Combat Cleanup Strike
You can help improve this page by editing it.

One main drop, one secondary drop, and one dungeon drop is rolled after the black stone dragon is defeated. The size of the group that went through the elite dungeon determines which drop table is used. There is a chance of additionally receiving a drop from the rare drop table.

Achievements[edit | edit source]

Main article: Black Stone Dragon achievements
  • Get Back, Hand! ( 5) – Use Forceful Backhand against a black hand during the Black Stone Dragon fight.
  • Shadow Wave ( 5) – Wave goodbye to a black hand.
  • Not a Moth ( 20) – Defeat the Black Stone Dragon without taking damage from any shadow flames.
  • Four in Hand ( 10) – Defeat all 4 black hands, within 10 seconds after defeating the first, during the Black Stone Dragon fight.
  • Whack Stone Dragon:
    • Whack Stone Dragon I ( 5) – Defeat the Black Stone Dragon. (X/5)
    • Whack Stone Dragon II ( 5) – Defeat the Black Stone Dragon. (X/10)
    • Whack Stone Dragon III ( 5) – Defeat the Black Stone Dragon. (X/25)
    • Whack Stone Dragon IV ( 5) – Defeat the Black Stone Dragon. (X/50)
    • Whack Stone Dragon V ( 5) – Defeat the Black Stone Dragon. (X/75)
    • Whack Stone Dragon VI ( 5) – Defeat the Black Stone Dragon. (X/100)
  • Whack Stone Dragon Solo Kills:
    • Whack Stone Dragon Solo Kills I ( 5) – Defeat the Black Stone Dragon while not in a group. (X/5)
    • Whack Stone Dragon Solo Kills II ( 5) – Defeat the Black Stone Dragon while not in a group. (X/10)
    • Whack Stone Dragon Solo Kills III ( 5) – Defeat the Black Stone Dragon while not in a group. (X/25)
    • Whack Stone Dragon Solo Kills IV ( 5) – Defeat the Black Stone Dragon while not in a group. (X/50)
    • Whack Stone Dragon Solo Kills V ( 5) – Defeat the Black Stone Dragon while not in a group. (X/75)
    • Whack Stone Dragon Solo Kills VI ( 5) – Defeat the Black Stone Dragon while not in a group. (X/100)

Update history[edit | edit source]

This information has been compiled as part of the update history project. Some updates may not be included – see here for how to help out!
  • ninja 14 March 2022 (Update):.
    • The drop rate of unique items across Elite Dungeon modes has been increased to give a unified drop rate per clear:
      • Draconic energy will now drop from the black stone dragon at 50% and 33% of the solo rates in duo and trio mode respectively. These rates are per player.
      • Greater ability codices from Astellarn, Verak Lith and the black stone dragon (per player).
        • Solo - 100/10,000 becomes 120/10,000.
        • Duo - 60/10,000 (unchanged).
        • Trio - 40/10,000 (unchanged).
  • patch 3 August 2020 (Update):
    • The Black Hands of Xau-Tak's defence has been slightly reduced during the encounter with the Black Stone Dragon in the Dragon Laboratory Elite Dungeon.
    • The height of the overhead enemy NPC target panel has been adjusted for the black hands of Xau-Tak, as well as several minibosses, in the Dragonkin Laboratory.
    • The black stone dragon's flaming spiral attack will no longer damage players after she is defeated.
    • Mopped up some blood in Astellarn's arena that could cause issues with targeted abilities such as Bladed Dive, and changed the blood in the Black Stone Dragon's arena into inactive scenery.
  • patch 20 May 2019 (Update):.
    • Both God Wars Dungeon 2 and Elite Dungeon bosses now award more Reaper points and Slayer XP when killed in challenge/hard mode.
  • patch 1 April 2019 (Update):
    • Particles within the black stone dragon encounter appear above the ground symbol when playing on the Java Client.
  • patch 20 August 2018 (Update):
    • It is no longer possible to pull the Black Stone Dragon outside of his arena.
    • Prevented a crash that occurred when the Black Stone Dragon was defeated in group mode, but the group wasn't aligned to the Dragonkin Laboratory.
  • update 13 August 2018 (Update):
    • Added to game.

Music unlocked[edit | edit source]

  • The Shackled Aberration
  • A Malice Unleashed

Trivia[edit | edit source]

  • The existence of the black stone dragon was first hinted at on release of the first elite dungeon, Temple of Aminishi. After releasing Seiryu from Xau-Tak's control, his dialogue refers to "another sharing his torment...under the obliterated crust of Forinthry."
  • The dragonkin research refers to her as "Kreath Takla Draekun", and while "Kreath" and "Draekun" are confirmed to translate to "Black" and "Dragon" respectively, it is still unconfirmed if the entire name is a literal translation.
  • The black stone dragon was referred to as male in one of the Patch Notes despite being female.

References[edit | edit source]

  1. ^ Dragonkin research, written by Kerapac, "Dragonkin Laboratory", RuneScape. "And, while it would be unscientific to note in my actual reports, I'm hearing whispers from nowhere while I'm around her. Today, after she had worn herself out trying to break through the walls into her sister's pen I heard these words in the back of my mind; 'Do you really think you can save them?' She can't talk, perhaps I'm going mad."
  2. ^ The Ambassador, "Curse of the Black Stone", RuneScape. "Did you think freeing the other two would weaken my hold on you?"
  3. ^ a b c d e f g h i j k l m n o p Mod Sova. Drop Rates - Elite Dungeon II. Reddit. 1 October 2018. (Archived from the original on 30 May 2020.)
  4. ^ a b c d e f g h i j k l m n o Jagex. Mod Sponge's Twitter account. 7 December 2021. (Archived from the original on 16 April 2022.) Mod Sponge: "Sure."
  5. ^ a b c Jagex. "This Week In RuneScape: Combat Cleanup Strike." 14 March 2022. RuneScape News.
  6. ^ a b c Jagex. JagexOrion's Twitter account. 10 October 2018. (Archived from the original on 30 May 2020.) JagexOrion: "Futon has 245 kills: You have a 4x higher chance to receive the pet on solo mode. You have not yet reached the threshold on group mode."
  7. ^ a b c Jagex. JagexOrion's Twitter account. 10 October 2018. (Archived from the original on 30 May 2020.) JagexOrion: "Correct. We're VERY happy that our systems allow us to re-use the previous elite dungeon code for new ones."
  8. ^ a b c Jagex. JagexOrion's Twitter account. 17 May 2019. (Archived from the original on 17 May 2019.) JagexOrion: "Elite dungeon duo pet rates and thresholds btw"
  9. ^ a b c Jagex. Mod Sponge's Twitter account. 7 December 2021. (Archived from the original on 16 April 2022.) Mod Sponge: "If you happen to roll pet, you never reach this table (it is a separate roll, that returns before this is reached)"
  10. ^ RuneScape. "mysterious perk :o." Twitch video. 21 July 2020. "Mod Orion: 'If you have the Mysterious perk on your equipment and you go into the dungeon, it's like 500x more common. So, enjoy your free pet.'"
